description.narrative: The United Nations Global Pulse initiative provides support for crisis monitoring which facilitates early policy interventions. The UN Global Pulse Initiative aims to use social media, mobile phone and new data technology to detect and monitor the impact of slow onset crises on vulnerable populations. This information is used to help shape better quality and more timely policy and program interventions. The initiative is focussed on developing a network of 'pulse labs' in developing countries. Pulse Labs are in-country data centres where data is collated and early signs of economic and social stress are monitored and analysed. The New York lab will act as a hub of operations and provide technical support for the lab network. There are two labs in development, Jakarta and Kampala. Australia's contribution supports global operations, however a contribution towards the Jakarta Pulse Lab will be used to facilitate the Global Pulses growth from the concept stage to its first year of operati
